title: TOP 6 MUST HAVE Jeans for Guys | Best FITTING Affordable denim

json.text:
What's up, its your boy Jose Zuniga and
today i'm gonna solve one of the biggest

problems that that exists in menswear, at
least in my opinion. You tell me if i'm

wrong. One of the hardest things to shop
for, when it comes to guy,  jeans. Which

sucks because it's the biggest essential
there is. I've worn almost every type of

denim you can think of, almost all the
brands out there. So today we're gonna be

going over the top six denim brands, you
should definitely be looking at. Let me

make a quick disclaimer, this video is
not sponsored by any of the brands that

I'm gonna talk about in this video. All
these brands, I wear constantly and I

genuinely think these are the best jeans
under $100. The first one Mott & Bow, I

just want to start off by saying that
this is also gonna be the most expensive,

everything else is actually very
affordable. But if you want a

high-quality pair of denim, something
that's in the last few years, this is a

brand you're gonna want to look into. I
personally own their straight raw

Rivington, which at the time that i
bought it i think was like 96 dollars.

It's made out of 100% cotton, the jeans
are super comfortable and something that

I noticed from personal experience, I've
owned these jeans for around two years,

the more you wear them the softer and
softer they get, the more comfortable

they get and the better they look. Which
is what you pay for when it comes to

quality. The second brand that produces
amazing jeans, Uniqlo. Now this brand

in particular is great for basics in
itself like jeans, t-shirts, polo shirts,

dress shirts, they don't really focus on
trendy stuff but more so those quality

basics guys should have. And they usually
are able to deliver those quality basics

super affordable, just to give you an
idea right before recording this video I

placed an order for a pair of raw denim
jeans off Uniqlo, they're nine dollars,

right now.
Nine dollars, that's the cheapest pair of

jeans i've ever seen and they're also
ninety eight percent cotton and not

something synthetic like polyester, it
does have two percent Spanx which is

good for a little bit of stretch. The
third brand that delivers great quality

denim at an amazing price point, Pacsun.
Pacsun in particular in my opinion

is more so for the younger guy, guys
looking for trendy or that street wear

aesthetic, PacSun is where you should be
buying your denim from. The only downside

to Pacsun personally, is that the fit
is really really tight so I did have to

go up one or two sizes, to make sure that
the pants

fit better through the thigh. Other than
that, the jeans feel amazing, they're

super comfortable and they're super
affordable, you can get one pair for $55

or when they go on sale like they are
right now you can get two for $55 which

ends up coming out to around roughly $28
bucks a pair.

The fourth brand that I love when it
comes to denim is, Zara. They have a huge

selection of denim, you go on to their
store there's, their always, it's a fast

fashion store so they're always dropping
your style. So you will find all the

colors you can think of that are
trending that season, you're gonna find

different styles of distressing and
you're gonna find different fits as well

for different body shapes. But the
biggest bonus is the quality and price

point, most of their denim ranges from 20
or 30 dollars and when it goes on sale

it's under 20 bucks, you can buy it
online and on top of that, most of their

denim at least the ones that I've
purchased and they've seen online it's a

hundred percent cotton. The fifth pair of
denim that fits amazing off the rack, H&M.

Surprisingly. I actually picked up this
pair of denim you're seeing right now,

it's a black pair from H&M about six
months ago and it fits absolutely

perfect off the rack. I didn't have to
size up, I didn't have to get it tailored,

it just fits good. What I like even more
about this denim it's that it's a

hundred percent cotton, so no synthetic
fabric whatsoever and what I noticed is

just like any other black denim the more
I wear it the more I wear it in,, the more

character it gets, the more it fades and
the better it looks aesthetically. On top

of that, I only paid like 20, 20 or 25
bucks for these jeans. And unlike Forever

21 or Pacsun  that are gonna give
you synthetic fabrics, like I said this

is a 100% cotton. One of their particular
fits that I always recommend is their

tapered fit, their tapered fit is great
if you have big thighs and you still

want that tapered leg at the bottom. It
gives you more room on the top and then

tapers drastically towards the bottom, so
it fits right off the rack without

having to tailor. And finally number six
the last brand the producers great denim,

Minimal. So this one again, this one is
kind of like a Pacsun more so for the

younger crowd. If you consider your
athletic more hypebeast or trendy or

Street wear, you need to be buying your
denim off Minimal. You get that high-end,

hype beast aesthetic for cheap basically.
One new features that they have

something called stretch denim, so this
particular denim tends to move a lot

with you throughout the day so it's very
comfortable to wear. The only thing is

that it's very tight, so I personally
sized up two sizes to make sure the

pants fit me right in the thighs. On top
of that, they're 100% cotton, at least the

pairs that I own. Everything's 100%
cotton, no synthetic fabric and it looks

amazing. So if you want something more
street wear for younger guys, check out

Minimal. And that's it for today's video
guys those are the top six brands you

should be checking out for your denim,
they fit right, they give you great

quality and they're super affordable. If
you guys liked this video and found it

informative don't forget to drop us a
like down below. Also don't forget to

check out our Spanish Channel everything
that we're doing here, we're doing it in
Spanish. So tell your friends about it.
That's it for me today, see you next time!
